_vid_default_mode.desc: This variable sets the default video mode that the client uses.

_vid_default_mode_win.desc: This variable sets the default video mode that the client uses when windowed.

values.description: Disable windowed mouse support so you can use the mouse in other applications.
values.name: false

values.description: Enabled windowed mouse support so you can use the mouse in the client.
values.name: true

values.description: Clients can download game data from the server.
values.name: true

values.description: Clients can download demo files from the server.

allow_download_gfx.desc: Enables downloading files from the server from the gfx directory.

values.description: Clients can download .bsp map files from the server.
values.name: true

values.description: Clients can download .mdl files from the server.
values.name: true

allow_download_other.desc: Enables downloading files from the server which are not in "skins", "progs", "sound", "maps" nor "gfx" directories.

values.description: Clients can download map files in paks from the server.
values.name: true

values.description: Clients can download .pcx skin files from the server.
values.name: true

values.description: Clients can download .wav sound files from the server.
values.name: true

values.description: Your client will not respond to f_cmdline checks.
values.name: false

values.description: Your client will respond to f_cmdline checks with your current command line used to run current ezQuake instance.
values.name: true

values.description: Your client will not respond to f_system checks.
values.name: false

values.description: Your client will respond to f_system checks displaying your PC configuration.
values.name: true

allow_scripts.desc: Possibility to prove, that you do NOT use scripts. Of course, values 0 and 1 will block 'rotate' command.
allow_scripts.remarks:
Your current 'allow_scripts' setting will be reported to 'f_scripts' query and anyone will be able to check it.
If anyone said 'f_scripts' since last mapchange, the client will also autoreport any change of allow_scripts. So if you don't use scripts, turn them off to prove you don't use them.
And remember - scripts _are allowed_, so don't call ppl who use them 'cheaters'.

This variable will be set to 0 on startup if a command line switches -norjscripts or -noscripts are used.

values.description:
Same as 1, but also block fast +lookdown/+lookup, so even simple rjump will be impossible.
Blocks KTPro /kfjump and /krjump aliases.

Allow only simple scripts - it will block left/right turning, so fjump (for example) will be impossible, but normal rjump (+lookdown;+attack;+jump) will be possible.
Blocks KTPro alias /kfjump too.

auth_validate.remarks:
If you have 'auth_warninvalid 1' and someone gives a dirty hash in a version response (because they are using a hacked client that can't work out the right response), the client will print something like
'Warning Invalid Client: playername (userid)' in your console ('auth_warninvalid 0' is default).

values.description: If you don't want your client to validate other ezQuake clients.
values.name: false

values.description: Performs the validation (but you need to use 'validate_clients')
values.name: true

values.description: the client hides the authentication CRC in f_version responses.
values.name: false

values.description: the client shows you the authentication CRC in f_version responses.
values.name: true

b_switch.desc:
This variable allows you to define the highest weapon that the client should switch to upon a backpack pickup.
The possible arguments of "b_switch" refer to the impulse that is used to switch to a certain weapon.
Note that a setting of 1 will effectively disable backpack weapon switching.

baseskin.desc: Defines what skin you see other people using if you don't have their skin and don't have skin forcing on.

bgmvolume.desc: This variable sets the volume of the CD music.

cam_dist.desc: Distance from player. Use +forward/+back to adjust it smoothly.

cam_lockdir.desc: Force camera to locked direction mode.

cam_lockpos.desc: Force camera to locked position mode.

cam_thirdperson.desc:
Enables third person view in demo playback and spectator mode.
In track mode, we look at the person being tracked rather than through his eyes.
Unlike cl_camera_tpp, you can use the mouse to look around.
cam_thirdperson.remarks: in track mode, we look at the person being tracked rather than through his eyes.

cam_zoomaccel.desc: To control how fast you zoom in onto the target with +forward/+back in cam_thirdperson mode.

cam_zoomspeed.desc: To control how fast you zoom in onto the target with +forward/+back in cam_thirdperson mode.

values.description: Backs up your old config before overwriting it with cfg_save.
values.name: true

cfg_browser_democolor.desc: Color of the demo entries in the cfg browser.

cfg_browser_dircolor.desc: Color of the dir entries in the cfg browser.

cfg_browser_interline.desc: Size of the space between entries in the cfg browser.

cfg_browser_scrollnames.desc: Toggle scrolling of the filenames in the cfg browser.

cfg_browser_selectedcolor.desc: Color of the selected entries in the cfg browser.

cfg_browser_showdate.desc: Toggle the date column in the cfg browser.

cfg_browser_showsize.desc: Toggle the file size column in the cfg browser.

cfg_browser_showstatus.desc: Toggle the display of the status bar in the cfg browser.

cfg_browser_showtime.desc: Toggle the time column in the cfg browse.

cfg_browser_sortmode.desc: Sorting mode in the cfg browser. Each number represents one column. Their order represents the priority of the sorting.

cfg_browser_stripnames.desc: Toggle stripping of the filenames in the cfg browser.

cfg_browser_zipcolor.desc: Color of the zip entries in the cfg browser.

values.description: Do not execute config.cfg and frontend.cfg in gamedir ever.
Execute config.cfg and frontend.cfg in gamedir (unless gamedir = qw)
Execute config.cfg and frontend.cfg even if gamedir = qw.
Execute config.cfg and frontend.cfg even if gamedir = qw. If not found in current gamedir, execute from qw dir.
Writes your command line in configs made with cfg_save (commented out of course)
values.name: true

cfg_save_onquit.desc: When enabled, your main configuration (config.cfg) will be saved when you exit the application.
cfg_save_onquit.remarks: Configuration will be saved in the main user configuration file, that is config.cfg which can either be placed in the quake/ezquake/configs in your quakedir, or in your home dir in /ezquake, depending on cfg_use_home setting.

values.description: Do not save configuration on exit
values.name: false

values.description: Automatically save the configuration on exit
values.name: true

values.description: Makes cfg_save only write variables that are not default valued to the config file.
values.name: false

values.description: Makes cfg_save write all variables to the config file.
values.name: true

cfg_save_userinfo.remarks:
Note: 'cfg_save_userinfo 1' is best for teamfortress so you don't get kicked for changing bottom color.
cfg_save will never save the password variable, even though technically it is a userinfo variable.

values.description: Save all userinfo variables except spectator, topcolor, bottomcolor, teamcolor, skin, team, rate, msg, w and b_switch.

cfg_use_gamedir.desc:
If set & gamedir is not 'qw', configurations will be saved to subdirectory based on gamedir.
Useful if configurations differ depending on gametype (e.g. team fortress)

cfg_use_home.desc: When turned on, configuration will be saved into user's profile (home) directory.
cfg_use_home.remarks: This affects only cfg_save and cfg_load commands.

values.description: Save the configuration into user's home dir
values.name: true

cl_anglespeedkey.desc: This variable sets multiplier by which your "cl_yawspeed" (how fast you turn) is multiplied when running (+speed).

cl_backspeed.desc:
This allows you to set your backward speed.
Obviously this is also limited by the server, usually to "320".
cl_backspeed.remarks: Sign of the value is ignored.

cl_bob.desc: This variable controls how much your weapon moves up and down when walking.

cl_bobcycle.desc: This variable determines how quickly your weapon moves up and down when walking.

cl_bobup.desc: This variable controls how long your weapon stays up before cycling when walking.

cl_bonusflash.desc: Controls weapon and item pickup flash.

cl_c2sImpulseBackup.desc:
Used with cl_c2spps, it controls how many backup copies of packets with non-zero impulses are to be sent to the server.
The recommended value is 3, but you can try 2 or even 1 to reduce traffic if you don't have any packet loss.

cl_c2spps.desc:
Packet filtering (a la Qizmo's .c2spps command).
Use this to reduce network traffic if you're playing on a 28800 (or worse) connection and can't set cl_maxfps 72 because it causes lag.
Also consider use of FPS independent physics in conjunction with cl_physfps.

cl_camera_death.desc: Camera view above your body after death.
cl_camera_death.remarks: Enabled only for viewing demos and observing games.

cl_camera_tpp.remarks: Enabled only for viewing demos and observing games.

values.description: 3rd person view ala Tomb Raider (such a fun!)

cl_camera_tpp_distance.desc:
Sets distance of 3rd person camera from tracked player.
You can use negative values too.
cl_camera_tpp_distance.remarks: For use with cl_camera_tpp. See cl_camera_tpp_height too.

cl_camera_tpp_height.desc:
Sets vertical position of 3rd person camera.
You can use negative values too.

cl_chasecam.desc: Toggle between 3rd-person view and 1st-person view while observing or during demo playback.

values.description: Text in the console is always treated as a command and in order to chat you have to use messagemode/messagemode2 or use the say/say_team commands.
Everything typed in the console goes into chat. In order to issue a command, prefix it with a slash (/).
If the first word in the line is a command, it is executed. Otherwise, the line is sent as chat.

cl_chunksperframe.desc: Affects the download speed when using chunked downloads, more chunks per frame results in higher download speed.
cl_chunksperframe.remarks: Servers can limit the amount of chunks sent per frame.

values.description: Shows the time you spent on server.

cl_clock_format.desc: Changes the format of the clock which is displayed if cl_clock is non-zero.
cl_clock_format.remarks: This was changed to an enumerated type in ezQuake 3.5, to match hud_clock_format.

cl_clock_y.desc:
Vertical coordinates of the clock.
If < 0, the coordinates are calculated from bottom up, e.g. -1 means the screen line just above the scoreboard.

cl_cmdline.desc: Read-only variable showing you what were the commandline options used to launch the client.

cl_confirmquit.desc: This sets whether to confirm on quit or quit with no confirmation.

values.description: Do not ask for confirmation on quit.
values.name: false

values.description: Ask for confirmation on quit. This will display the 'About' message box where you have to press [Y] to quit.
values.name: true

cl_crossx.desc: This variable allows you to move the position of the crosshair on the X-axis by the specified amount of pixels.

cl_crossy.desc: This variable allows you to move the position of the crosshair on the Y-axis by the specified amount of pixels.

cl_crypt_rcon.desc: Encrypts rcon messages sent to server.

cl_curlybraces.desc: Enables new syntax to be used for Quake scripting allowing you to enclose commands into curly braces.
cl_curlybraces.remarks: See scripting manual for further info.

values.description: Filter dead bodies after they fall on the ground.
Filter dead bodies (instantly) unless you are playing a TeamFortress game.

cl_debug_antilag_ghost.desc: Allows rendering a translucent copy of player position on supported .mvd/qtv streams.

cl_debug_antilag_lines.desc: Chooses if lines are drawn between the different player positions on supported .mvd/qtv streams.

cl_debug_antilag_self.desc: Chooses whether to include the currently tracked player in antilag debugging.

cl_debug_antilag_send.desc: Sends location of opponents, which is stored in .mvd on supported servers.

cl_debug_antilag_view.desc: Chooses which location is used when rendering players on supported .mvd/qtv streams.

cl_debug_weapon_send.desc: Sends information about client-side weapon selection, which is stored in .mvd on supported servers.

cl_debug_weapon_view.desc: Views the client-side weapon debugging messages, if stored in .mvd.

cl_delay_packet.desc: Client will delay incoming and outgoing packets, allowing user to increase his ping in the game.
cl_delay_packet.remarks: Specified in ms. If delay is 20ms, incoming packets will be delayed by 10ms, outgoing packets too. It's preferred to use the least value that gives the desired ping.

cl_delay_packet_deviation.desc: Allows random deviation to be added to /cl_delay_packet delay.
cl_delay_packet_deviation.remarks: Specified in ms.  Makes /cl_delay_packet better simulate high-ping connections.

cl_delay_packet_target.desc:
Targets a particular ping, rather than specifying the additional delay.
Adds half the ping to the outgoing packet and the remainder to incoming.

cl_demo_qwd_delta.desc:
Whether or not to write delta packets for entities into .qwd files.
Older clients may not be able to play these back.

cl_demoPingInterval.desc:
How often to request ping updates when recording demos.
This variable doesn't affect ping updates when the scoreboard is shown (they are always one update per 2 seconds).

cl_democlock.desc: A clock showing how much time has elapsed since the start of the demo.

cl_democlock_x.desc: Determine where the democlock is positioned on your screen on the X co-ordinate.

cl_democlock_y.desc: Determine where the democlock is positioned on your screen on the Y co-ordinate.

cl_demoplay_flash.desc: Reduces flash grenade effect when watching demos.

cl_demospeed.desc: Controls the speed of demo playback in percentage (can be changed during demo playback if you wish).

cl_demoteamplay.desc: If set, teamplay settings enabled during .dem playback.

cl_earlypackets.desc:
Read network data independently on physical frames.
When using independent physics, network data will be read as early as possible, compared to the old way when it was read only on every physframe (77 times per second).

cl_fakename.desc: Automatically prefixes all team messages with a shorter version of your nick unless the message has a "fake" part already (so no configs are broken).

cl_fakeshaft.desc:
Smoothes out shaft movement.
0 = no smoothing at all
1 = 100% smoothing
A value of about 0.5 is recommended for modem players.

Note that this only affects the visual display of the shaft beam; the 'true' beam remains in the original location.

values.description: Update shaft position only when network packet received from server
Prevents r_drawviewmodel from being changed by servers like Rocket Arena.
values.name: true

cl_fix_mvd.desc: A fix for buggy MVD demos, making the client to parse them properly
cl_fix_mvd.remarks: Was caused by a flaw in MVDSV server

cl_forwardspeed.desc:
This allows you to set your forward speed.
Obviously this is also limited by the server, usually to "320".
cl_forwardspeed.remarks: Sign of the value is ignored.

cl_fp_messages.desc: This variable is used in conjunction with the variable "cl_fp_persecond" to define when the floodprot protection should be triggered (if "cl_floodprot" is set to "1").

cl_fp_persecond.desc: This variable is used in conjunction with the variable "cl_fp_messages" to define when the floodprot protection should be triggered (if "cl_floodprot" is set to "1").

cl_gameclock.desc: Displays clock with seconds on the screen.
cl_gameclock.remarks: Use cl_gameclock_x and cl_gameclock_y to place it anywhere on the screen.

values.description: Counts up from the start of the match.
Counts down from the start of the match.
Same as 1 but only minutes:seconds (hours are not being displayed).
Same as 2 but only minutes:seconds (hours are not being displayed).

cl_gameclock_offset.desc: Allows using gameclock in custom mods that don't support standard KT-like clock synchronization.
cl_gameclock_offset.remarks: Some Capture The Flag or Team Fortress mods can take a use of this.

cl_gameclock_x.desc: Adjusts horizontal placement of the clock with seconds.
cl_gameclock_x.remarks: See cl_gameclock for detailed info about the clock.

cl_gameclock_y.desc: Adjusts vertical placement of the clock with seconds.
cl_gameclock_y.remarks: See cl_gameclock for detailed info about the clock.

cl_hiderockets.desc: Toggles rockets visibility. Variable cl_r2g must be 0 to cl_hiderockets 1 work.

cl_hightrack.desc: Turns auto-tracking player with most frags ON when spectating or watching a demo.

cl_hud.desc:
Enables/Disables strings-hud.
Strings hud is not mqwcl hud. It gives you ability put any string (or value of some variable) on your hud.
cl_hud.remarks: Strings hud banned for ruleset smackdown.

values.description: The inventory is drawn on the right side of the screen.
values.name: false

values.description: The inventory is drawn on the left side of the screen.
values.name: true

cl_iDrive.desc:
Emulates "strafe script". When turned on you will always move to some direction when holding both keys +moveleft and +moveright (or +forward and +back).
If you have this turned on, it will be reported in your f_ruleset reply with as (+i) flag.
Cannot be changed during the gameplay.

values.description: Pressing keys for both directions will cause stop in movement
values.name: false

values.description: Auto-releases one of the keys when both directions are pressed
values.name: true

cl_independentPhysics.desc:
This enables independent physics. This means that you can achieve more FPS in the game than allowed by the server.
The amount of FPS used to communicate with the server is set by /cl_physfps and the amount of graphics FPS is set by /cl_maxfps.
Note that you must have vid_vsync 0.
cl_independentPhysics.remarks: This variable can only be switched from 0<->1 when disconnected from a server (Qizmo/eztv are also servers).

values.description: QW compatibility: all keypad keys treated as though equivalent button pushed, eg KP_8 acts like uparrow would.

You will be able to bind all numpad keys independently of standard keys.
Use kp_enter, kp_8 etc to differentiate from standard keys.
As 'cl_keypad 0' in game, 'cl_keypad 1' when in menus/console etc.

cl_lerp_monsters.desc: Enables linear interpolation on Quake monsters and creatures.

cl_loadFragfiles.remarks: Also needed to parse stats for extended scoreboard and frags tracker.

values.description: Enable displaying team fortress related statistics in the scoreboard (flag touches, steals, caps, etc)
values.name: true

cl_maxfps.desc: This variable sets the maximum limit for frames-per-second. Please see vid_vsync, cl_independentphysics, and cl_physfps.

cl_mediaroot.desc: Changes where demos, screenshots and logs are saved, how variables demo_dir, sshot_dir and log_dir are treated.

values.description: Treat paths as relative to the Quake dir
Treat paths as relative to user home dir
Treat paths as system absolute paths
Rotating models bob up and down like in Quake3.
values.name: true

cl_movespeedkey.desc: This variable is the multiplier for how fast you move when running (+speed) in relation to when walking (-speed).
cl_movespeedkey.remarks: Sign of the value is ignored.

cl_multiview.desc: This client adds a multiview component to mvd playback. Up to four views can be displayed at once. Use this variable to turn multiview on.

values.description: Still no multiview but you can use cl_mvdisplayhud to show small complex hud.
Own flash off, all other on.

cl_mvdisplayhud.desc: Toggle drawing of small compact HUD in each screen of Multiview control.
cl_mvdisplayhud.remarks: Also see cl_mvhudpos and cl_mvhudvertical when this is set to a value greater than 1.

values.description: Don't draw mini-HUDs when in multiview.
Draw original mini-HUDs when in multiview. (Only strings)
Draw graphics. Icons for weapons, healthbar, armorbar.
Same as 3 but with values showing the health/armor on the bars.
Same as 4 but with a semitransparent black background.

cl_mvhudflip.desc: Flips the mini-HUD in multiview mode.
cl_mvhudflip.remarks: This only works when cl_mvdisplayhud is greater than 1. See also cl_mvhudvertical and cl_mvhudpos.

cl_mvhudpos.desc: Sets the position of the multiview mini-HUDs.
cl_mvhudpos.remarks:
This only applies to the mini-HUD when cl_mvdisplayhud has a value greater than 1.
Otherwise old mini-HUD will be used (just strings).

values.description: The mini-HUDs are all "gathered" towards the center of the screen. Top left view has the hud in the lower right corner; bottom left view has it in the upper left corner and so on.
values.name: gather

values.description: The mini-HUDs are all "gathered" towards the center of the screen. Top left view has the hud in the lower right corner; bottom left view has it in the upper left corner and so on.
values.name: g

cl_mvhudvertical.desc: Set whetever the mini-HUDs in multiview mode will be drawn vertically or not.
cl_mvhudvertical.remarks: This only applies if cl_mvdisplayhud has a value greater than 1, otherwise the old style is used for the mini-HUDs (only strings).

cl_mvinset.desc: Turns inset screen with multitrack on/off.

values.description: Divide screen in 2/3/4 areas according to cl_multiview settings.
values.name: false

values.description: Display 2nd POV inside main screen in the right top corner.
values.name: true

cl_mvinsetcrosshair.desc: Turn crosshair in inset POV in multiview on/off.

values.description: Do not display crosshair in inset POV.
values.name: false

cl_mvinsethud.desc: Turns inset HUD for inset POV with multiview on/off.

values.description: Display inset HUD (usually nick of tracked player).
values.name: true

cl_name_as_skin.desc: Allows you to override user skin settings and use player's name or ID as a his (her) skin.
cl_name_as_skin.remarks: There are many other skin settings that can override, e.g. all enemy*skin, team*skin settings override this setting.

values.description: Use player's name as his skin
Use player's ID as his skin

cl_net_clientport.desc: The UDP port opened by the client for communication with the server.
cl_net_clientport.remarks: Can set to 0 to use a dynamically allocated port

cl_newlerp.desc:
Experimental rockets/grenades/spikes smoothing code.
Default value 0.1 means: use 90% of our 'vision' and 10% of server 'vision'. Should be OK for most case, but floating ping (see remarks)
cl_newlerp.remarks: Range between 0 and 1. This smoothing algorithm works well only with stable ping.

cl_nodelta.desc:
Control the network packet delta compression.
When you get blue lines in your netgraph, you should set 'cl_nodelta 1'.

cl_nofake.desc: This command effects name faking using $/ or cl_fakename used by players.

cl_nolerp.desc:
Allows you to disable the linear interpolation (lerp) of objects in the game.
Information about objects' states arrive periodically via the net connection. By default between these moments the client tries to interpolate where the object are. After the new packet arrives client corrects the position of the object.
If the interpolation is disabled, client will leave object in the state described in the last received packet until a new one arrives.

cl_nolerp_on_entity.desc:
Disables linear interpolation only when player is standing on an entity.
It is a workaround to remove jittering of floating platforms under feets.
cl_nolerp_on_entity.remarks: No effect if fps independent physics is turned off. See cl_nolerp.

cl_nopred.desc: For debugging, disables movement prediction for your character; other players are still predicted.

cl_novweps.desc: If set, disables support for zquake vwep extension.

cl_onload.desc: Tells what will be the start-up screen of the client.

values.description: Server browser will be your start-up screen
values.name: browser

values.description: After start-up you can immediately type into the console
values.name: console

values.description: You'll see the main menu after the start-up
values.name: menu

values.description: A command/script to be executed on start-up
values.name: <other>

values.description: Enable displaying team fortress related statistics in the scoreboard (flag touches, steals, caps, etc).
values.name: true

cl_parseFunChars.remarks:
Full list:
$R - red lamp
$G - green lamp
$B - blue lamp
$Y - yellow lamp
$\ - carriage return
$( - big left bracket
$= - big equal sign
$) - big right bracket
$. - red middle dot
$, - white dot (names only)
$< - small left bracket
$- - small equal sign
$> - small right bracket
$a - big grey block
$: - line feed
$b - filled red block
$d - right pointing red arrow
$[ - gold left square bracket
$] - gold right square bracket
$^ - white ^ (names only)
^x - red x (names only)
$0-9 - yellow number
$xyy - char with hex code yy
(In order to use the lamps, you'll need the Ocrana pak).

values.description: You can use Ocrana LED's by hand right out of the console and chat anonymously through "$\" without showing your name (chat messages that are seen without your name at the beginning).
values.name: true

values.description: You can use macros such as %a %h %l (like in Qizmo).
values.name: true

cl_parseWhiteText.desc: Convert text between { and } to white or not in chat/team chat.

cl_pext.desc: If set, enable support for FTE's protocol extensions.

cl_pext_256packetentities.desc: Allow protocol extension for allowing more packet entities.

cl_pext_alpha.desc: If set, enable support for FTE's alpha attribute protocol extension.

cl_pext_chunkeddownloads.desc: Enables protocol extension called "Chunked downloads". Allows you to download maps and demos from servers faster.

cl_pext_floatcoords.desc: If set, enable support for FTE's floating point coordinate protocol extension.

cl_pext_lagteleport.desc:
Enable support for MVDSV to correct movement commands when travelling through teleports.
See https://www.quakeworld.nu/forum/topic/7239 for more details.
cl_pext_lagteleport.remarks: You must reconnect to the server for changes to take effect.

values.description: Server will adjust movement in the delay between entering & exiting teleports
values.name: true

cl_pext_limits.desc: Enable support for FTE's extensions to support enhanced number of entities and models.

values.description: FTE extensions disabled.  Some enemies/projectiles may be invisible.
values.name: false

cl_pext_other.desc: Allows other protocol extensions other than Chunked downloads.

cl_pext_warndemos.desc: If set, warning will be displayed when recording a demo that is not backwards compatible with old clients.

cl_physfps.desc:
Sets the amount of FPS used to communicate with the server.
This variable is used when cl_independentphysics 1 is set, and controls the FPS sent/received to/from the server.
The graphical FPS is limited by cl_maxfps (vid_vsync must be 0).

When set to 0, the current cl_maxfps value is used.
When cl_maxfps is set to 0 too, client displays as much FPS as server and data rate allows.

cl_physfps_spectator.desc:
Amount of updates the client will send/receive while being spectator.
Lower values make the client smooth-out the field of view movement greatly.
cl_physfps_spectator.remarks: This can increase your ping (only) when you are a spectator.

cl_pitchspeed.desc: This variable determines how fast you you turn up/down when using "+lookup" and "+lookdown".

cl_predict_half.remarks: The new default eliminates player models' jittering when independent physics is enabled; a possible downside is larger prediction errors of modem players' movement, hence the option to revert to old behavior.

values.description: Full prediction of players' movement (ezQuake default)
values.name: false

cl_predict_players.desc: This toggles the prediction for other players' movement. Unless you are having problems this variable should be left at "1".

cl_proxyaddr.desc: IP address of the proxy server to use while connecting to servers.
cl_proxyaddr.remarks: This will override the /connect and /reconnect commands so that the connection is established via given proxy server.

cl_restrictions.desc: Triggers and re/msg trigger restrictions for spectator and demoplay modes.
cl_restrictions.remarks: FuhQuake always behave as cl_restrictions 1. QW262 by default it have cl_restrictions 1.

cl_rollalpha.desc: You can turn off the 'dodging' or 'rolling' effect for your own point of view while still see other player models affected by cl_rollangle.
cl_rollalpha.remarks: 0 disables, 1 is standard. Disabled by ruleset smackdown.

cl_rollangle.desc: This variable controls how much your screen tilts when strafing.

cl_rollspeed.desc: This variable controls how quickly you and other players straighten out after strafing.

cl_savehistory.desc: Save console commands history to .ezquake_history. Loads history from this file while starting ezquake.

cl_sayfilter_coloredtext.desc: Allows you to filter your own outgoing messages out of markup that is used in this client to send colored text.
cl_sayfilter_coloredtext.remarks:
Colored text is not supported by some other clients. See cl_sayfilter_sendboth for compatibility mode with other clients.
If you want to filter incoming messages out of colors, use scr_coloredtext.

values.description: Filter out colored and white text markup

cl_sayfilter_sendboth.desc: When used with cl_sayfilter_coloredtext, sends two versions of the teamplay colored messages: colored one with "#c" at the end and uncolored version of the message with "#u" at the end of the message.
cl_sayfilter_sendboth.remarks: FuhQuake users then can use "filter #u" to see only uncolored messages, ezQuake users can set "filter #c" to see only colored messages.

values.description: Send only one version of the message
values.name: false

values.description: Send two versions of the message
values.name: true

cl_showkeycodes.desc: This variable enables/disables the output of informations to the currently pressed and/or released keys.

values.description: Switch off output of scancode/keymapping information (Default)
information about keys will be printed when the keys are pressed.
information about keys will be printed when releasing the keys.
information about keys will be printed when the keys are pressed and also when they are released.

cl_shownet.desc: This variable toggles the display of current net info.

values.description: Print current incoming packet size in byte.
Print information about the current in coming packet and it's size.

cl_sidespeed.desc:
This allows you to set your strafe speed.
Obviously this is also limited by the server, usually to "320".
cl_sidespeed.remarks: Sign of the value is ignored.

values.description: Will convert +jump commands to +moveup commands when in liquid (water, lava, slime) and in spectator mode.
values.name: true

cl_solid_players.desc: If not set then client will not perform collision detection against other players.

cl_startupdemo.desc: Demo that should be played on client's startup.

cl_sv_packetsync.desc: Determines if internal server should process packets as soon as received from client.
cl_sv_packetsync.remarks:
Should only affect playing on local server, when cl_delay_packet is enabled.
Recommend to disable for older mods which fake players (frogbots) and leave enabled for KTX.

cl_textencoding.desc: Determines method used to encoding non-standard characters in outgoing messages.

values.description: Use UTF8 encoding (larger range of characters)

cl_timeout.desc: This variable defines the timeout value in seconds until the client considers himself to be disconnected from the server.

cl_upspeed.desc:
This allows you to set the speed with which you move up and down in liquids or in spectator mode.
Obviously this is also limited by the server, usually to 320*0.7 = 224 when being in liquid and to 500 in spectator mode.
cl_upspeed.remarks: Sign of the value is ignored.

cl_useimagesinfraglog.desc: Turns on using images in the frags tracker window to show which weapon did take the role in the frag.
cl_useimagesinfraglog.remarks: See Tracer Stats manual page for further info.

cl_useproxy.desc: This toggles whether Qizmo should be used (if detected) to a server. When enabled the server browser will use an existing connection to a Qizmo when connecting another server by using the ezQuake Server Browser.

values.description: do not use Qizmo to connect a server chosen in the Server Browser
values.name: false

values.description: use Qizmo to connect a server chosen in the Server Browser
values.name: true

cl_verify_qwprotocol.desc: Enables the check on client startup for handling URLs starting with qw://
cl_verify_qwprotocol.remarks: When enabled and the client is not associated with handling of qw:// URLs, user will be prompted if he wishes to associate the client with the protocol.

values.description: Do not check if client is associated with qw:// URLs
Check if client is associated, prompt if not
Always associate client with qw:// URLs

cl_voip_capturingvol.desc: Volume multiplier applied while capturing, to avoid your audio from being heard by others.

cl_voip_micamp.desc: Amplifies your microphone when using voip.

cl_voip_send.desc: Enable sending of voice (voip) to the server.
cl_voip_send.remarks: Commands +void / -void emulate toggling this value to 2.

cl_voip_showmeter.desc: Shows your speech volume above the at the bottom-left of the screen.

cl_voip_showmeter_x.desc: Adjust horizontal position of the voice volume meter.

cl_voip_showmeter_y.desc: Adjust vertical position of the voice volume meter.

cl_voip_vad_delay.desc: Keeps sending voice data for this many seconds after voice activation would normally stop.

cl_voip_vad_threshhold.desc: This is the threshhold for voice-activation-detection when sending voip data.

cl_warncmd.remarks: Note: Not saved to config with cfg_save command.

cl_warnexec.desc: If set, the names of script files will be printed to console as they are executed.

values.description: weapon/impulse command sets best weapon order, will select best weapon as ammo or weapon obtained
weapon/impulse command picks best weapon at the time of command, with fallback to axe or sg (see /cl_weaponhide_axe)

cl_weaponhide.desc: On -attack will cause your weapon to be automatically switched back to the shotgun or axe.
cl_weaponhide.remarks: This is used in majority of teamplay games. If you don't have ammo for shotgun the axe gets selected.

values.description: Weapon will not be automatically hidden
After you fire your weapon, it will get switched to shotgun or axe
Like option 1, but only for deathmatch mode 1.

cl_weaponhide_axe.desc: Determines if axe should be used as "dummy" weapon when using automated weapon hiding (cl_weaponhide).

cl_weaponpreselect.desc:
When using the weapon command, this variable allows weapon preselection instead of standard immediate weapon selection.
Preselection means that the preselected weapon will be switch right before +attack command, that is right before you shoot from your weapon.
cl_weaponpreselect.remarks:
Usefull in most teamplay games where you don't want to carry your best weapon in your hands but want to be ready to instantly shoot from it.
Note: Doesn't work for impulse command, you have to use new weapon command.

values.description: Weapon preselection when not holding +attack. When holding +attack, select weapon immediately.
Like option 1, but only for deathmatch mode 1, otherwise like 0.
Like option 2, but only for deathmatch mode 1, otherwise like 0.

cl_window_caption.desc: Choose different window caption formats for your taskbar when you play in windowed mode or when the client is minimized in the taskbar.
cl_window_caption.remarks: The caption doesn't refresh regularly on some configurations. We recommend to use vid_flashonactivity 1 as well.

cl_yawspeed.desc: This variable defines how quickly you turn left (+left) or right (+right).

con_bindphysical.remarks: con_bindphysical will always be set to 1 at start of executing a script, and be reset after.

values.description: 'bind x y' will bind y to the key used to produce character x at the console (layout-aware)
'bind x y' will bind y to physical key x, as if using an American keyboard layout (layout independent)
Messages stay even when you toggle console.
values.name: false

values.description: Messages won't say when you toggle console.
values.name: true

con_completion_changed_mark.desc: Whether add or not asterisk before variables which values were changed.

con_completion_color_changed_mark.desc: Color of changed mark used in modern completion formatting.

con_completion_color_colon.desc: Color of colon used in modern completion formatting.

con_completion_color_name.desc: Color of variable name in used in modern completion formatting.

con_completion_color_quotes_current.desc: Color of quotes of current variable value used in modern completion formatting.

con_completion_color_quotes_default.desc: Color of quotes of default variable value used in modern completion formatting.

con_completion_color_title.desc: Color of completion type title (variables, aliases or commands) used in modern completion formatting.

con_completion_color_value_current.desc: Color of current variable value used in modern completion formatting.

con_completion_color_value_default.desc: Color of default variable value used in modern completion formatting.

con_completion_format.remarks:
- Modern: plain list with colorization.
 - Old: somehow grouped list without colorization.

values.description: Modern one, shows current and default values
Modern one, shows current values only
Modern one, shows default values only
Modern one, shows current and default values if it differs
Modern one, without any values of cvars

con_completion_padding.desc: Number of spaces to pad command completion variants.

con_deadkey.desc: Set this if the console toggle button is also a deadkey. The operating system will be sent a backspace character as the console is toggled.

con_fragmessages.desc: Controls whether frag messages should be printed into console and notification area.
con_fragmessages.remarks: Requires cl_loadfragfiles and cl_parsefrags variables to be set to 1.

values.description: Print frag messages to console and notification area (QW default).
Print frag messages to console only

con_funchars_mode.desc: Orange text, LEDs and special chars with [Ctrl] key - kind of MQWCL behaviour when set to 1.

values.description: FuhQuake behaviour: [Ctrl] + key for yellow numbers and LEDs
values.name: false

values.description: MQWCL behaviour: [Ctrl] + [Y] turns on yellow number input
values.name: true

con_hide_chat_input.desc: Hides the input of own chat text in the console.

con_highlight.desc: Console highlighting mode. Will highlight a line in the console which contains your nickname.

values.description: Highlighted line will be all white.
Highlighted line will start with the text given in con_highlight_mark
Both 1 and 2: highlighted line will be white and start with special text

con_highlight_mark.desc: Specifies the text that will be used to highlight lines with con_highlight 2 and 3.

values.description: This text will be used on the beginning of the highlighted line

con_mm2_only.desc: If set, notification area is limited to mm2 (/say_team) messages.

con_notify.desc: Toggles the display of the notification area.
con_notify.remarks: Notification area is the place where chat and game messages are displayed.

con_notifylines.desc: This variable sets the maximum number of notify lines (default 4, max 15) to be used at the top of the screen.

con_notifytime.desc: How long console messages stay on screen.

con_proportional.desc: Enable TrueType fonts on console text.

con_shift.desc: Adjusts vertical offset of background of the console.

con_tilde_mode.desc: When enabled, allows you to use the tilde key also in the console and when typing messages.
con_tilde_mode.remarks: To exit the console with con_tilde_mode 1, use Escape.

values.description: Always use tilde to toggle the console
Treat tilde as a key leading to typing the character associated with it (tilde does not close the console)
Same as 1, but tilde does close the console if the console is empty

con_timestamps.desc: Toggles time stamps before mm1 or spectator messages. Does not apply to messages with cl_fakename.

coop.desc:
Whether the next "map" command should start a coop (cooperative) game.
Only works when deathmatch var is 0, otherwise coop will be forced off and a deathmatch game will start.

You need a file, spprogs.dat, in your quake/qw/ folder for coop games to work.

crosshairalpha.desc: This command regulates crosshair transparency, you can use any value from "0" to "1".

crosshaircolor.desc: This variable defines the color of the crosshair.

crosshairimage.desc: The filename of the crosshair image.
crosshairimage.remarks: Crosshair images should be placed in ./ezquake/crosshairs or ./qw/crosshairs directory.

crosshairscale.desc: When using built-in crosshairs, increases the resolution of the crosshair, giving a crisper image on screen.
crosshairscale.remarks: Max value 5. Increasing this value will require lowering of /crosshairsize to give same size image on screen.

crosshairscalemethod.desc: Determines how crosshair images are scaled.
crosshairscalemethod.remarks: When changing this value, /crosshairscale & /crosshairsize should be adjusted accordingly.

value.description: No scaling, sizes are in pixels

crosshairsize.desc: Performs basic scaling of the crosshair.
crosshairsize.remarks: Maximum value 20. For example, /crosshairsize 0.5 halves the size, and /crosshair 2 doubles it.

cvar_viewdefault.desc: When you type a cvar name into console (like 'gl_gamma' or 'r_rocketlight'), the client will tell you the default value of the cvar.

cvar_viewhelp.desc: Automatically prints manual page when a variable name is typed in the console.

cvar_viewlatched.desc: When you type a variable name in the console, you'll be able to see it's latched value if this is turned on.
cvar_viewlatched.remarks: Latched values are used for example for renderer settings. Variable value is latched until the renderer is restarted, in that moment the latched value becomes the actuall value of the variable.

values.description: Perspective correction only every 16 pixels (faster, less accurate).
values.name: true

deathmatch.desc: Chooses between basic multiplayer gameplay modes.

values.description: Weapons stay after pickup, ammo/armor does not (not used)
Arena mode: players have all weapons and full health/armor

default_fov.desc:
Very useful in TeamFortress, and other mods that reset your fov when you spawn to 90.
Basically, when the server sends you "fov 90", your fov is set to default_fov.

demo_autotrack.desc: Enables server-side autotrack to be accepted.
demo_autotrack.remarks: Server-side autotrack is recorded in MVD demos and in QTV stream allowing all the observers of the match observe the same player at the same time.

demo_benchmarkdumps.desc:
Allows you to automatically dump timedemo benchmark results into $log_dir/timedemo.log file.
The output is in XML markup format and contains info about your operating system, hardware configuration, client version, rendering, screen resolution and the result FPS.
demo_benchmarkdumps.remarks:
See timedemo command description for more info.
Note: The result file is not a well-formed XML file.

demo_browser_democolor.desc: Color of the demo entries in the demo browser.

demo_browser_dircolor.desc: Color of the dir entries in the demo browser.

demo_browser_interline.desc: Size of the space between entries in the demo browser.

demo_browser_scrollnames.desc: Toggle scrolling of the filenames in the demo browser.

demo_browser_selectedcolor.desc: Color of the selected entries in the demo browser.

demo_browser_showdate.desc: Toggle the date column in the demo browser.

demo_browser_showsize.desc: Toggle the file size column in the demo browser.

demo_browser_showstatus.desc: Toggle the display of the status bar in the demo browser.

demo_browser_showtime.desc: Toggle the time column in the demo browser.

demo_browser_sortmode.desc: Sorting mode in the demo browser. Each number represents one column. Their order represents the priority of the sorting.

demo_browser_stripnames.desc: Toggle stripping of the filenames in the demo browser.

demo_browser_zipcolor.desc: Color of the zip entries in the demo browser.

demo_capture_background_threads.desc: Determines how many background threads should be used writing images to disk.

demo_capture_codec.desc: Determines what codes should be used for captured video stream compression. E.g: xvid, divx, x264, ...

demo_capture_mp3.desc: When set to 1 .avi capturing captures sound compressed in MP3 format.

demo_capture_mp3_kbps.desc: Sets bitrate for captured sound stream when demo_capture_mp3 is set to 1.

demo_capture_quiet.desc: Stops sound being played during demo capture.

demo_capture_steadycam.desc: Changes behaviour of keyboard/mouse input when capturing.

demo_capture_vid_maxlen.desc: If set, multiple files will be created. This variable determines length of each file in MB.
demo_capture_vid_maxlen.remarks: The .avi format has issues with files over 2GB in size.

demo_dir.desc: Change the demos and autorecord directory.

demo_format.desc: Specifies the demo file format used when recording demo with Match tools.

values.description: MultiView Demo, usually contains less frames per second.
values.name: mvd

demo_getpings.desc: This toggles whether the client should always record pings into the demo or only when the player died and show(team)scores are being shown (QWCL default).

values.description: only update pings in the demo when the player died and show(team)scores are being shown
values.name: false

demo_jump_rewind.desc: Specifies the automatic rewind time before /demo_jump_mark or /demo_jump_status triggers normal playback.
demo_jump_rewind.remarks: Time in seconds, must be negative.

values.description: will not loop the demo playlist
values.name: false

demo_playlist_track_name.desc:
will set the default track name in the demo playlist for mvd demos.
Example: jogi, will always track the player jogi or versions of it (jogihoogi, angryjogi, etc).

developer.desc: Enables debug mode which prints more messages into the console than for normal user.

download_map_url.desc: MVDSV : URL announced to clients for faster map downloads over HTTP.

enemybothskin.desc: Overrides the enemy quad pent skin so you can define the skin which applies to enemys with both the quad and pent powerups.

enemybottomcolor.desc: Determines the color of the pants of the enemies you see. Overrides player's skin settings.
enemybottomcolor.remarks: To be able to use RGB 24bit colors, look for r_enemyskincolor variable.

enemyforceskins.desc: Allows you to set different skin for every enemy player even if they all have same skin names set or use names of skins that you do not have in your Quake dir.
enemyforceskins.remarks: Read "Player skins" manual page for more info on skin rules.

values.description: Use player's name as the name of the skin to be used
Use player's userid number (only useful for video capturing)
Assign skins "e1", "e2", "e3", etc. to the enemies.

enemypentskin.desc: Overrides the enemy pent skin so you can define the skin which applies to enemy pents.

enemyquadskin.desc: Overrides the enemy quad skin so you can define the skin which applies to enemy quads.

enemyskin.desc: Overrides the enemies skin so you can define the skin which applies to enemies.

enemytopcolor.desc: Determines the color of the shirt of the enemies you see. Overrides player's skin settings.
enemytopcolor.remarks: To be able to use RGB 24bit colors, look for r_enemyskincolor variable.

file_browser_archive_color.desc: Color of archive files in the file browser.

file_browser_dir_color.desc: Color of directories in the file browser.

file_browser_file_color.desc: Color of files in the file browser.

file_browser_interline.desc: Spacing between each row in the file browser. 0-6.

file_browser_scrollnames.desc: If set, the currently selected file will scroll to let you see the full name.

file_browser_selected_color.desc: Color of the current selection in the file browser.

file_browser_show_date.desc: Toggles whether the file modified date is shown in the file browser.

file_browser_show_size.desc: Toggles whether the filesize is shown in the file browser.

file_browser_show_status.desc: Toggles whether a statusbar is shown in the file browser.

file_browser_show_time.desc: Toggles whether the file modified time is shown in the file browser.

file_browser_sort_mode.desc: Determines sort order of files in the file browser.

values.description: sort by name, then by type

file_browser_strip_names.desc: If set, strips extra spaces from filenames in the file browser.

values.description: Only IP addresses on the Ban list will be allowed onto the server.
values.name: false

values.description: Only IP addresses NOT on the Ban list will be allowed onto the server.
values.name: true

floodprotmsg.desc:
Sets the message displayed after flood protection is invoked.
Example: floodprotmsg "Shut up whiner!"

font_capitalize.desc: Draw all TrueType text in capital letters.

font_gradient_alternate_color1.desc: Top color in Alternate TrueType text.

font_gradient_alternate_color2.desc: Bottom color in Alternate TrueType text.

font_gradient_alternate_percent.desc: Slope of the gradient for Alternate TrueType text.

font_gradient_normal_color1.desc: Top color in Normal TrueType text.

font_gradient_normal_color2.desc: Bottom color in Normal TrueType text.

font_gradient_normal_percent.desc: Slope of the gradient for Normal TrueType text.

font_gradient_number_color1.desc: Top color in Number TrueType text.

font_gradient_number_color2.desc: Bottom color in Number TrueType text.

font_gradient_number_percent.desc: Slope of the gradient for Number TrueType text.

font_outline_width.desc: Scale of the outline around TrueType text.

fov.desc: This variable defines your field of vision, which determines how close your vision field is to the objects.
fov.remarks:
The default value is 90, however many players prefer using a higher FOV.
Note that this would typically be scaled up when using a monitor with widescreen aspect ratio.

fraglimit.desc: Amount of frags any player has to reach before the match is over.
fraglimit.remarks: When set to 0, there won't be any limit.

values.description: Both -mlook and freelook 0 must be specified to disable free look mode.
values.name: false

values.description: Enables free look mode, that is, moving the mouse forward and back moves your view
values.name: true

fs_cache.desc: Enables Quake File System caching of files lists.

gender.desc: Indicates the gender of the player.
gender.remarks: This relies on server/mod support to function correctly.

gl_alphafont.desc: Allows alpha transparency layer support for the console font.

values.description: Use only 2 levels of transparency for console font
values.name: false

values.description: Use full 256 levels of transparency for console font
values.name: true

gl_anisotropy.desc: Anisotropic filtering. Improves texture detail on angled surfaces.
gl_anisotropy.remarks: Depends on your Graphics card capabilities and settings. Make sure you have set your graphic card's Anisotropic Filtering setting to "Application controlled".

values.description: 0 and 1 means turned off, then usually up to 16 for the highest quality.

gl_bounceparticles.desc: Controls whether sparks bounce off walls.
gl_bounceparticles.remarks: Bouncing particles look nicer, but may eat up CPU.

gl_brush_polygonoffset.desc: Offset drawing of entity models to stop z-fighting.
gl_brush_polygonoffset.remarks: Disabled for qcon (can cause flickering areas, most often on Intel cards).

gl_buildingsparks.desc: Buildings that are destroyed in TF will continue to throw sparks until they disappear.

gl_caustics.desc: Enable reflections in submerged areas (under water, lava, slime).
gl_caustics.remarks: Multi-texturing is required for this setting.

gl_charsets_min.desc: Speeds up start-up time by only searching for minimum number of charsets during start-up.

values.description: Search for full range of unicode charsets
values.name: false

values.description: Search for default and -cyr only (as per ezQuake 2.2)
values.name: true

gl_clear.desc: Clears the screen between each frame to prevent the hall-of-mirrors glitch when flying outside of the map.
gl_clear.remarks: This can cause problems when going through the surface of a liquid, as you may see a colored flash where the liquid texture would normally glitch.

gl_clipparticles.desc: Limits the number of blended particles close to you. This can give a big FPS increase when blended particles take up a big proportion of your screen and challenge your video card's fillrate.

gl_colorlights.desc: Toggles color on lighting from glowing items (quad, pent, flags in TF, etc).
gl_colorlights.remarks: This implementation does not give a speed increase when gl_colorlights is set to 0, but it does not require a map restart for changes to take effect.

gl_consolefont.desc:
Changes your console font.
Put all your charset images in qw/textures/charsets/*.png (and *.tga).
"/gl_consolefont original" will restore the 8bit font in your gfx.wad.
gl_consolefont.remarks: loadcharset is an alias for gl_consolefont.

gl_coronas.desc:
Adds coronas to some effects:

 - Explosions: Basically just a bright flash since the default explosions didn't feel powerful enough.
 - Muzzleflashes.
 - Lightning.
 - Fire: Torches have glows.
 - Rocket Lights.

gl_coronas_tele.desc: Allows you to turn on/off blue light when spawning.

gl_cshiftpercent.desc: This variable sets the percentage value for palette shifting effects (damage flash, powerup blend). (needs gl_polyblend 1).

gl_custom_grenade_color.desc: Allows color of grenades to be set without requiring a texture change.
gl_custom_grenade_color.remarks:
Leave blank to disable.
See gl_custom_grenade_fullbright.

gl_custom_grenade_fullbright.desc: Determines if gl_custom_grenade_color refers to a fullbright color or standard.
gl_custom_grenade_fullbright.remarks: Has no effect if gl_custom_grenade_color is blank.

gl_custom_grenade_tf.desc: Allows gl_custom_grenade_* variables to be ignored when playing Team Fortress.

gl_custom_lg_color.desc: Allows color of lightning shaft to be set without requiring a texture change.
gl_custom_lg_color.remarks:
Leave blank to disable.
Has no effect if particle shaft is enabled.

gl_custom_lg_fullbright.desc: Determines if gl_custom_lg_color refers to a fullbright color or standard.
gl_custom_lg_fullbright.remarks: Has no effect if gl_custom_lg_color is blank.

gl_custom_lgpack_color.desc: Color lightning gun backpacks with this value.
gl_custom_lgpack_color.remarks: Leave blank to disable. QTV/MVD only, KTX 1.38+ only.

gl_custom_rlpack_color.desc: Tints rocket launcher backpacks with this value.
gl_custom_rlpack_color.remarks: Leave blank to disable. QTV/MVD only, KTX 1.38+ only.

gl_custom_rocket_color.desc: Allows color of rockets to be set without requiring a texture change.
gl_custom_rocket_color.remarks:
Leave blank to disable.
See gl_custom_rocket_fullbright.

gl_custom_rocket_fullbright.desc: Determines if gl_custom_rocket_color refers to a fullbright color or standard.
gl_custom_rocket_fullbright.remarks: Has no effect if gl_custom_rocket_color is blank.

gl_custom_spike_color.desc: Allows color of spikes/nails to be set without requiring a texture change.
gl_custom_spike_color.remarks:
Leave blank to disable.
See gl_custom_spike_fullbright.

gl_custom_spike_fullbright.desc: Determines if gl_custom_spike_color refers to a fullbright color or standard.
gl_custom_spike_fullbright.remarks: Has no effect if gl_custom_spike_color is blank.

gl_cutf_tesla_effect.desc: When a shambler is preparing to throw lightning, or a tesla coil (TF) is charging to fire, a particle effect is generated.

gl_detail.desc: Toggles an extra layer of fine detail over world textures.
gl_detail.remarks: Can impact performance on weak GPUs.

gl_detpacklights.desc: A little green light appears on the detpack, and when the timer reaches 5, the light changes to red.
gl_detpacklights.remarks: gl_coronas must be turned on for this to work.

gl_ext_texture_compression.desc: Compress textures on GPUs that support it to save VRAM, at the cost of longer load times and degraded quality.
gl_ext_texture_compression.remarks: No longer needed when you have many hundreds of Mb of VRAM.

gl_externalTextures_bmodels.desc: Toggles loading external 24-bit textures for non-world bsp models, i.e. health and ammo boxes.

gl_externalTextures_world.desc: Toggles loading external 24-bit textures for the world, i.e. the actual map.

gl_extratrails.desc:
Misc trails that appear on objects that frequently move, such as TF grenades, caltrops, etc.
Railguns in TF also leave behind unique trails.

gl_fb_bmodels.desc: Enable "fullbright" colors on bsp models (World, health boxes, etc). Might give you a couple more fps.

gl_fb_models.desc: Enable "fullbright" colors on alias models (grenades, player models, etc). Might give you a couple more fps.

gl_finish.desc: Toggles the calling of the gl_finish() OpenGL function after each rendered frame.

gl_flashblend.desc: This variable affects when glow bubbles are displayed in the client. You can change the color of the rocket glow by r_rocketLightColor, the color of explosions by r_explosionLightColor, and the color of flag carriers by r_flagColor.

values.description: A glow bubble will appear on explosions and flag/quad/pent carrier.
Same as (1), but also around rockets in the air.

gl_fog.remarks: See also other gl_fog cvars for fine-tuning.

gl_fogblue.desc: Blue component in the color of the fog.

gl_fogend.desc: Sets ending distance for rendering the fog.

gl_foggreen.desc: Green component in the color of the fog.

gl_fogred.desc: Red component in the color of the fog.

gl_fogsky.desc: Also apply fog effects to the sky.
gl_fogsky.remarks: Fog tends to look out of place when this is not enabled.

gl_fogstart.desc:
Sets starting distance for rendering the fog.
The greater the number is, the better visibility in game is and the fog is "thinner".

gl_hwblend.desc: Toggles between OpenGL and Hardware palette changing.

gl_inferno_speed.desc: Changes speed of gl_inferno missile trail.

gl_inferno_trail.desc: Changes type of gl_inferno missile trail.

gl_lerpimages.desc: Improves quality of non-power of two textures, at a slight load time cost. No impact on framerates.
gl_lerpimages.remarks: Only applies to GPUs which do not support non-power of two textures.

values.description: Worse texture quality, faster loading maps.
values.name: false

values.description: Better texture quality, slower loading maps.
values.name: true

gl_lighting_color.desc: Alias models are effected by colored lights around them.

gl_lighting_vertex.desc:
Alias models no longer have the same level of light on all sides.
This may not work correctly if colored lighting is disabled.

gl_lightmode.desc:
Enables overbright lightmaps.
Brings more contrast, making world lighting look more like software Quake, and less like GLQuake.
gl_lightmode.remarks: Takes effect when the map reloads.

values.description: Makes the map lighter, but fullbrights don't look as good. (0% overbrights)
values.name: false

values.description: Makes the map darker, but makes fullbrights stand out more (looks better). (33% overbrights)
values.name: true

gl_lightning.desc:
Toggles particle lightning beams.
May be restricted by rulesets.

gl_lightning_color.desc: The RGB color of particle lightning beam and sparks.

gl_lightning_size.desc: Adjusts size of lightning particle beam.

gl_lightning_sparks.desc: Sparks fly from walls when hit by lightning gun.

gl_loadlitfiles.desc:
Controls when external 24-bit lighting will be used.
24-bit/colored lighting is either embedded in newer .bsp files, or loaded from external .lit files.

values.description: Load lit files & use inline colored lighting.

gl_luma_level.desc: Some luma textures have black non-transparent pixels. This can make them transparent.
gl_luma_level.remarks: Setting this to 0 will disable the functionality. For some commonly used texture packs value 1 is necessary.

values.description: e.g. value 10 makes particular pixels transparent if each color component is LESS than 10.

gl_lumatextures.desc: Turns using luma textures (named *_luma) ON when set to 1 and allowed by server.

gl_max_size.desc:
This variable determines the detail level for loaded textures.
When set to "1", the objects and walls will be textured with 1x1 pixel textures.

gl_miptexLevel.desc:
Downscale textures in a way that looks like the 'd_mipcap' setting from classic software-rendered QW.
Has no effect on external 24-bit textures.

gl_modulate.desc: Controls how bright the lightmap gets. Values from 0.5 to 3 are valid.

gl_motion_blur.desc: Enables motion blur effect (set gl_motion_blur_* variables to configure)

gl_motion_blur_dead.desc: Level of blending of current scene with previous, when the player is dead.

gl_motion_blur_fps.desc: How often to copy the current frame to apply motion blur effect. Defaults to 77.

gl_motion_blur_hurt.desc: Level of blending of current scene with previous, when the player has recently been hurt.

gl_motion_blur_norm.desc: Level of blending of current scene with previous, when the player is alive and not recently hurt.

gl_multisamples.desc: The number of samples used around each pixel for anti-aliasing. Range 0-16.

gl_nailtrail.desc: Adds a white trail onto nails as they fly around.
gl_nailtrail.remarks: This feature won't work on servers not running with sv_nailhack set to 1.

gl_nailtrail_plasma.desc: Adds a blue plasma trail to nail trails.

gl_nailtrail_turb.desc: Switches between two type of bubbles nails leave behind in water.

gl_oldlitscaling.desc: Scales lit files the 'old' way ('makes colored areas too dark').

gl_outline.desc: Controls outlining of models and map.
gl_outline.remarks: Outlining of the world is only valid when cheats are enabled.

values.description: Outline models to create rotoscope effect

gl_part_blobs.desc: Determines particles used for blob explosions (EMPs).

gl_part_blood.desc: Determines particles used for blood effects.

gl_part_cache.description: Reduce CPU overhead when newer particle effects are used.

gl_part_detpackexplosion_fire_color.desc: Change color of the detpack explosion fire (TF).

gl_part_detpackexplosion_ray_color.desc: Change the color of the detpack explosion rays (Team Fortress).

gl_part_inferno.desc: Determines particles used for pyro flames in TF.

gl_part_lavasplash.desc: Determines particles used for lava splashes (Spy Gren).

gl_part_spikes.desc: Determines particles used for spikes (nailgun etc).

gl_part_telesplash.desc: Determines particles used for teleport effects.

gl_part_tracer1_color.desc: Changes the color of the tracer1 trail, which allows you to customize the rockettrail color (see remarks).
gl_part_tracer1_color.remarks: If you set r_rockettrail 6 and gl_part_trails 1, this variable will change your rockettrail color.

values.description: "R G B" format accepted, e.g. "255 255 0" for yellow

gl_part_tracer1_size.desc: Changes the size of the tracer1 trail, which allows you to customize the rockettrail size (see remarks).
gl_part_tracer1_size.remarks: If you set r_rockettrail 6 and gl_part_trails 1, this variable will change your rockettrail size.

gl_part_tracer1_time.desc: Changes the duration of the tracer1 trail, which allows you to customize the rockettrail (see remarks).
gl_part_tracer1_time.remarks: If you set r_rockettrail 6 and gl_part_trails 1, this variable will change your rockettrail duration.

gl_part_tracer2_color.desc: Changes the color of the tracer2 trail, which allows you to customize the rockettrail color (see remarks).
gl_part_tracer2_color.remarks: If you set r_rockettrail 7 and gl_part_trails 1, this variable will change your rockettrail color.

values.description: "R G B" format accepted, e.g. "255 255 0" for yellow

gl_part_tracer2_size.desc: Changes the size of the tracer2 trail, which allows you to customize the rockettrail size (see remarks).
gl_part_tracer2_size.remarks: If you set r_rockettrail 7 and gl_part_trails 1, this variable will change your rockettrail size.

gl_part_tracer2_time.desc: Changes the duration of the tracer2 trail, which allows you to customize the rockettrail (see remarks).
gl_part_tracer2_time.remarks: If you set r_rockettrail 7 and gl_part_trails 1, this variable will change your rockettrail duration.

gl_part_trails.desc: Determines particles used for (rocket etc) trails.

gl_particle_blobs.desc:
Determines size of blob explosions.
If set to 0, standard non-particle explosions will be used instead.

gl_particle_blood.desc:
Determines size of blood effect.
If set to 0, standard blood effect will be used instead.

gl_particle_blood_type.desc: Chooses among types of blood particles.

gl_particle_deatheffect.desc: Adds extra blood effects to gibs.

values.description: Death effect enabled for all corpses
Death effect for gibbed players only

gl_particle_fire.desc:
Replaces torches with a particle flame effect.
Includes people being burnt by the pyro in TF.

gl_particle_fulldetail.desc: Allows full detail depth for gl_particle_* effects.

gl_particle_gibtrails.desc: Enable alternate gib trails with bright blood.

gl_particle_gunshots_type.remarks: Light flashes also appear with gl_coronas 1.

gl_particle_muzzleflash.desc: Adds a particle effect when monsters and other players fire a weapon.

gl_particle_shockwaves.desc: Controls the volumetric shockwave for the alternate blob explosion effects (r_explosiontype 6).

gl_particle_shockwaves_flat.desc: Adds a flat, orange shockwave to alternate explosion effects.

gl_particle_sparks.desc:
Controls particle sparks.
Trails appear more beam-like and don't look stupid when they bounce.
This applies for wizards and knights only.

gl_particle_spikes.remarks: Light flashes also appear with gl_coronas 1.

gl_particle_spikes_type.remarks: Light flashes also appear with gl_coronas 1.

gl_particle_telesplash.desc: Enable alternative teleport effect with extra sparks.

gl_particle_trail_detail.desc: Controls the level of detail on the particle lightning beams, and some types of sparks.

gl_particle_trail_length.desc: X - Multiplies the length of the trail on particle trails.

gl_particle_trail_time.desc: X - Multiplies the length of time the particle bounces around for.

gl_particle_trail_type.desc: Changes the type of particle on alt. gunshots, fuel rod explosions...

values.description: A mist of small white pebbles.

gl_particle_trail_width.desc: Changes width of particle trails, e.g. wall hit by nail, explosion particles trail, etc.

gl_picmip.desc: Determines the level of detail for world textures.
gl_picmip.remarks: Does not apply to models, liquids, simple icons, but you can also picmip these with the gl_playermip and gl_scale* cvars.

gl_playermip.desc: Determines the level of detail of player model textures.

gl_polyblend.desc:
Controls a short burst of screen tinting when submerged, taking a powerup, or taking damage.
Variables to look at are: gl_cshiftpercent  (controls overall palette shifting) v_damagechisft v_quadcshift  v_pentcshift v_ringcshift v_suitcshift.

gl_powerupshells.desc: Enables a flashing layer over players carrying powerups.

gl_powerupshells_size.desc: Size of the powerupshells effect layer.

gl_program_aliasmodels.desc: Determines if GLSL will be used to render aliasmodels.
gl_program_aliasmodels.remarks: Applies to classic OpenGL renderer only.

gl_program_hud.desc: Determines if GLSL will be used to render the HUD.
gl_program_hud.remarks: Applies to classic OpenGL renderer only.

gl_program_sky.desc:
Determines if GLSL will be used to render skybox/skydome surfaces.
r_fastsky does not use this setting.
gl_program_sky.remarks: Applies to classic OpenGL renderer only.

gl_program_sprites.desc: Determines if GLSL will be used to render sprites.
gl_program_sprites.remarks: Applies to classic OpenGL renderer only.

gl_program_turbsurfaces.desc:
Determines if GLSL will be used to render 'liquid' surfaces.
r_fastturb does not use this setting.
gl_program_turbsurfaces.remarks: Applies to classic OpenGL renderer only.

gl_program_world.desc: Determines if GLSL will be used to render world surfaces (walls, floors..).
gl_program_world.remarks: Applies to classic OpenGL renderer only.

gl_rl_globe.desc: Helps customize rocket light independent of gl_flashblend.

values.description: Rocket light looks like with gl_flashblend 2, but no dynamic lighting
Rocket light looks like with gl_flashblend 0 or 1
Rocket light looks like with gl_flashblend 2, with dynamic lighting

gl_scaleTurbTextures.desc: Applies picmip/max_size/miptexlevel to turb textures (lava, water, slime, teleports).

gl_scaleskytextures.desc: Applies picmip/max_size/miptexlevel to sky textures (skydome and skybox).

gl_simpleitems.desc: Toggles drawing simple icons instead of 3D item models.

gl_simpleitems_size.desc: Size of simple items. Max size 16.

gl_smoothfont.desc: Smooths out the font (which = good). But in some cases the font wasn't designed to be smoothed (sometimes the case of custom console fonts etc).

gl_smoothmodels.desc: Toggles between flat-shaded and smooth shaded models.
gl_smoothmodels.remarks: Applies to GLSL OpenGL renderer only.

gl_squareparticles.desc: Toggles between circle and square particles.

gl_subdivide_size.desc:
This variable sets the division value for the sky brushes.
The higher the value the better the performance, but the smoothness of the sky suffers.

gl_surface_lava.desc: Adds boiling bubbles over the lava.

gl_surface_slime.desc: Adds bubbles and fumes of slime over the slime.

gl_textureless.desc:
Toggles between textures and flat colors based on the textures (looks like gl_max_size 1).
For custom colors, look for r_drawflat.
gl_textureless.remarks: Can not be changed during a match.

values.description: Use flat colors averaged from the world textures.
values.name: true

gl_texturemode.remarks: GL_NEAREST* modes are often used with gl_miptexlevel 3.

values.description: Trilinear interpolation. Highest quality, lowest performance.
values.name: GL_LINEAR_MIPMAP_LINEAR

values.description: Point sampled (software-like). Lowest quality, highest performance.
values.name: GL_NEAREST

values.description: GL_NEAREST but with even more quality for far objects.
values.name: GL_NEAREST_MIPMAP_LINEAR

values.description: GL_NEAREST but with a bit more quality for far objects.
values.name: GL_NEAREST_MIPMAP_NEAREST

gl_texturemode_viewmodels.remarks: GL_NEAREST* modes are often used with gl_miptexlevel 3.

values.description: Trilinear interpolation. Highest quality, lowest performance.
values.name: GL_LINEAR_MIPMAP_LINEAR

values.description: Point sampled (software-like). Lowest quality, highest performance.
values.name: GL_NEAREST

values.description: GL_NEAREST but with even more quality for far objects.
values.name: GL_NEAREST_MIPMAP_LINEAR

values.description: GL_NEAREST but with a bit more quality for far objects.
values.name: GL_NEAREST_MIPMAP_NEAREST

gl_triplebuffer.desc: Triple buffering of HUD graphics. If you have problems with screen graphics, turn this on.
gl_triplebuffer.remarks: This has nothing to do with 3D rendering, it will not increase graphics "lag" or anything like that. It only affects 2D HUD graphics.

gl_turb_effects.desc: Controls if shotgun/nailgun impact points will spawn bubbles underwater.
gl_turb_effects.remarks: Requires QMB particles to be enabled (corresponding gl_particle_xxx option enabled).

gl_turb_fire.desc: Controls if explosions/fire will spawn bubbles underwater.
gl_turb_fire.remarks: Requires QMB particles to be enabled (corresponding gl_particle_xxx option enabled).

gl_turb_trails.desc:
This gives rockets/grenades/nails and other things an alternate underwater trail.
Very nice to have nailgun fights underwater...

gl_turbalpha.desc:
This variable determines the level of opacity for liquids, which requires the use of maps that were VISed with transparent water.
When using maps that have not been VISed in such a way, you have to use "r_novis 1".
If "r_novis" is set to "1" or when using a map VISed with transparent water and using setting "gl_turbalpha" to a value lower than "1", the player will be able to see objects and walls through liquids if the server allows that.
This is a very nice feature to have in the game, for more information refer to the "r_novis" command.

You can use any value between "0" and "1" for "gl_turbalpha", here are some examples:

gl_turbfog.desc:
Controls amount of fog when inside liquid (water, lava, slime).
Density is controlled by choosing a value from 0 to 1 and from 1 to 2.
gl_turbfog.remarks: Multi-texturing is required for this setting.

values.description: Fog in liquids is turned OFF

gl_turbfogDensity.desc: Control of density of liquid (water, lava, slime...) fog.

gl_vbo_clientmemory.desc: Use client memory when rendering dynamic geometry.
gl_vbo_clientmemory.remarks: No effect unless using compatibility mode.

gl_weather_rain.desc:
Turns on rain outdoors.
Rain density is equal to whatever gl_weather_rain is set to.
gl_weather_rain.remarks: Works on all custom maps except death32c, dakyne and some others.

help_files_dircolor.desc: The RGB color of directories in the help browser.

help_files_filecolor.desc: The RGB color for files in the help browser.

help_files_interline.desc: Adjust interlining of file list in /help filebrowser.

help_files_scrollnames.desc: Should the filenames in the help browser get scrolled if they don't fit when the file is selected?

help_files_selectedcolor.desc: The RGB color of a selected file in the help browser.

help_files_showdate.desc: Shows column displaying file last modification date in /help file browser.

help_files_showsize.desc: Shows column displaying file size in /help file browser.

help_files_showstatus.desc: Show quick info about selected help file in /help file browser.

help_files_showtime.desc: Shows column displaying file last modification time in /help file browser.

help_files_sortmode.desc: Switches sorting methods of files /help file browser.

hostname.desc: Server variable, changes the name of the server displayed in server browsers and server lists.

hud_ammo1_align.desc: Sets align of number of shells for both horizontal and vertical direction.

hud_ammo1_align_x.desc: Sets horizontal align of number of shells.

hud_ammo1_align_y.desc: Sets vertical align of number of shells.

hud_ammo1_digits.desc: Sets number of digits for number of shells.

hud_ammo1_frame.desc: Sets frame visibility and style for number of shells.

hud_ammo1_frame_color.desc: Defines the color of the background of the ammo1 HUD element. See HUD manual for more info.

hud_ammo1_order.desc: This defines the order of drawing the HUD elements. That means you can change will be drawn on top of other elements. See HUD manual for more info.

hud_ammo1_place.desc: Sets relative positioning for number of shells.

hud_ammo1_pos_x.desc: Sets horizontal position of number of shells.

hud_ammo1_pos_y.desc: Sets vertical position of number of shells.

hud_ammo1_scale.desc: Sets size of number of shells.

hud_ammo1_show.desc: Switches showing of number of shells.

hud_ammo1_style.desc: Switches graphical style of number of shells.

hud_ammo2_align.desc: Sets align of number of nails.

hud_ammo2_align_x.desc: Sets horizontal align of number of nails.

hud_ammo2_align_y.desc: Sets vertical align of number of nails.

hud_ammo2_digits.desc: Sets number of digits for number of nails.

hud_ammo2_frame.desc: Sets frame visibility and style for number of nails.

hud_ammo2_frame_color.desc: Defines the color of the background of the ammo2 HUD element. See HUD manual for more info.

hud_ammo2_order.desc: This defines the order of drawing the HUD elements. That means you can change will be drawn on top of other elements. See HUD manual for more info.

hud_ammo2_place.desc: Sets relative positioning for number of nails.

hud_ammo2_pos_x.desc: Sets horizontal position of number of nails.

hud_ammo2_pos_y.desc: Sets vertical position of number of nails.

hud_ammo2_scale.desc: Sets size of number of nails.

hud_ammo2_show.desc: Switches showing of number of nails.

hud_ammo2_style.desc: Switches graphical style of number of nails.

hud_ammo3_align.desc: Sets align of number of rockets.

hud_ammo3_align_x.desc: Sets horizontal align of number of rockets.

hud_ammo3_align_y.desc: Sets vertical align of number of rockets.

hud_ammo3_digits.desc: Sets number of digits for number of rockets.

hud_ammo3_frame.desc: Sets frame visibility and style for number of rockets.

hud_ammo3_frame_color.desc: Defines the color of the background of the ammo3 HUD element. See HUD manual for more info.

hud_ammo3_order.desc: This defines the order of drawing the HUD elements. That means you can change will be drawn on top of other elements. See HUD manual for more info.

hud_ammo3_place.desc: Sets relative positioning for number of rockets.

hud_ammo3_pos_x.desc: Sets horizontal position of number of rockets.

hud_ammo3_pos_y.desc: Sets vertical position of number of rockets.

hud_ammo3_scale.desc: Sets size of number of rockets.

hud_ammo3_show.desc: Switches showing of number of rockets.

hud_ammo3_style.desc: Switches graphical style of number of rockets.

hud_ammo4_align.desc: Sets align of number of cells.

hud_ammo4_align_x.desc: Sets horizontal align of number of cells.

hud_ammo4_align_y.desc: Sets vertical align of number of cells.

hud_ammo4_digits.desc: Sets number of digits for number of cells.

hud_ammo4_frame.desc: Sets frame visibility and style for number of cells.

hud_ammo4_frame_color.desc: Defines the color of the background of the ammo4 HUD element. See HUD manual for more info.

hud_ammo4_order.desc: This defines the order of drawing the HUD elements. That means you can change will be drawn on top of other elements. See HUD manual for more info.

hud_ammo4_place.desc: Sets relative positioning for number of cells.

hud_ammo4_pos_x.desc: Sets horizontal position of number of cells.

hud_ammo4_pos_y.desc: Sets vertical position of number of cells.

hud_ammo4_scale.desc: Sets size of number of cells.

hud_ammo4_show.desc: Switches showing of number of cells.

hud_ammo4_style.desc: Switches graphical style of number of cells.

hud_ammo_align.desc: Sets align of current ammo value.

hud_ammo_align_x.desc: Sets horizontal align of current ammo value.

hud_ammo_align_y.desc: Sets vertical align of current ammo value.

hud_ammo_digits.desc: Sets number of digits for current ammo value.

hud_ammo_frame.desc: Sets frame visibility and style for current ammo value.

hud_ammo_frame_color.desc: Defines the color of the background of the ammo HUD element. See HUD manual for more info.

hud_ammo_order.desc: This defines the order of drawing the HUD elements. That means you can change will be drawn on top of other elements. See HUD manual for more info.

hud_ammo_place.desc: Sets relative positioning for current ammo value.

hud_ammo_pos_x.desc: Sets horizontal position of current ammo value.

hud_ammo_pos_y.desc: Sets vertical position of current ammo value.

hud_ammo_scale.desc: Sets size of current ammo value.
